{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|since=c++23|1=
constexpr auto end();
}}
{{dcl|num=2|since=c++23|1=
constexpr auto end() const
    requires ranges::range&lt;const InnerView&gt; &amp;&amp;
        std::regular_invocable&lt;const F&amp;,
            /*REPEAT*/(ranges::range_reference_t&lt;const V&gt;, N)...&gt;;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Returns an {{rlp|iterator}} or a {{rlp|sentinel}} representing the end of the {{rlpt|/|adjacent_transform_view}}.

Let {{rlpi|/#Data members|inner_}} be the underlying {{lc|ranges::adjacent_view}}.

@1@ Equivalent to:
{{source|1=
if constexpr (ranges::common_range&lt;InnerView&gt;)
    return /*iterator*/&lt;false&gt;(*this, inner_.end());
else
    return /*sentinel*/&lt;false&gt;(inner_.end());
}}
@2@ Equivalent to:
{{source|1=
if constexpr (ranges::common_range&lt;const InnerView&gt;)
    return /*iterator*/&lt;true&gt;(*this, inner_.end());
else
    return /*sentinel*/&lt;true&gt;(inner_.end());
}}

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
An {{rlp|iterator}} to the element following the last element, if the underlying view {{c|V}} models {{lconcept|common_range}}. Otherwise, a {{rlp|sentinel}} which compares equal to the end iterator.

===Notes===
{{c|adjacent_transform_view&lt;V,F,N&gt;}} models {{lconcept|common_range}} whenever the underlying view {{c|V}} does.
